heading: emi to sell cds on demand
subheading: coming to a music store near you: kiosks that download tunes and spit out freshly minted cds at your request. by oscar s. cisneros.
author: craig bicknell
text: a second music publisher will be delivering its catalogue to stores digitally, enabling customers to create cds on demand. emi, the world's third largest music label, announced tuesday that the bulk of its vast tune library will now be available for download through digital on demand's proprietary red dot network.the network makes entire albums available to in-store kiosks for preview or purchase in about a minute. consumers can have the album burned and printed on the spot, including liner notes, cover art, and the freshly copied cd.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
